NoteLiteral.En:
The micro-module will be delivered in the KTU virtual learning environment. When a student is enrolled in KTU, s/he will be informed by email on how to gain access to the micro-module.
After the successful completion of the micro-module: 
•	In two weeks, a student will receive an email with the link to download the ECIU University micro-credential. 
•	In mid-June 2025, a student from other university than KTU will receive an email with the KTU Transcript of Records that might be presented for recognition of learning outcomes at the home university.

Description.En: Today's world is characterised by increasing social and professional mobility and extensive contact among people who are often not only distant in terms of space, but are also culturally different from each other. As a consequence, ‘contact and interaction (physical and virtual) between diverse peoples, languages, cultural models, media and practices’ have now become the norm rather than an exception. Naturally, these developments have inevitable repercussions: on the one hand, they affect the ways in which people communicate in settings that involve participation of individuals with different cultural and linguistic backgrounds; on the other hand, the way communication and language as such are understood also become less stable.

NoteLiteral.En: Students will be able to identify academic concepts relevant to intercultural communication and cultural models.
Students will be able to reflect on own experience.

PrefLabel.En: evaluate data, information and digital content

NoteLiteral.En: Students will be able to assess and use information appropriately in different contexts.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
Each week, you will have to view one-two videos lasting for about 10 minutes each. The videos will elucidate the core theory and provide real-life examples.  The videos will be followed by additional practical activities. At the end of each week, you will have to do a self-assessment quiz on the newly acquired knowledge. In addition, you will be asked to reflect on an open-ended question and provide your answer in the discussion forum; your fellow course participants will be able to access it too. A list of additional self-study sources will be provided to you each week.

Specifically, the assessment consists of:  

20 % - active participation in the discussion forum (answering one open-ended question at the end of each week and commenting on colleagues’ answers);  

40 % - completion of the course tasks (watching videos and completing tasks and self-assessment tests (5 questions at the end of each week);  

40 % - final written assignment (i.e. design of a workshop aimed at improving intercultural communication skills for a specific target audience, combined with an analysis of relevant literature. An assessment rubric will be provided.)

[Syllabus of the micro-module](https://uais.cr.ktu.lt/ktuis/stp_report_ects.mdl_ml?p_kodas=MM00M103&p_year=2024&p_lang=EN&p_stp_id=)

For inquiries related to the content of the course, please consult the Q&A section of the Moodle course or email me at donata.lisaite@ktu.lt.

The micro-module will be delivered in the KTU virtual learning environment. When a student is enrolled in KTU, s/he will be informed by email on how to gain access to the micro-module.

After the successful completion of the micro-module:

- In two weeks, a student will receive an email with the link to download the ECIU University micro-credential.
- In mid-June 2025, a student from other university than KTU will receive an email with the KTU Transcript of Records that might be presented for recognition of learning outcomes at the home university.
Bridging Cultures: Master the Art of Understanding and Connection

This course is suitable for students who are interested in gaining a more in-depth understanding of what intercultural communication entails. Specifically, in this course students will be familiarised with a range of aspects pertaining to culture and cultural models. Furthermore, properties of human communication; the role of language and communication styles will be discussed. Ultimately, aspects that are relevant for effective intercultural communication will be addressed. The course involves discussion and analysis of both theoretical insights and practical real-life examples related to intercultural communication.

Entry requirements:

- Student at any of the universities of the ECIU;
- B2 level of English language proficiency.

Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card / passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol in the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page).  

Students, who are admitted and accepted the offered place in the micro-module, will be informed by email on the steps to take in order to gain access to the KTU virtual learning environment. Students will receive an email from the teacher of the micro-module on the first day of the start of module.  

Students who have dropped out from the KTU micro-module(s) in the autumn 2024 are not eligible to enrol in the KTU micro-module(s) in the spring 2025.
